Description: Rim and body sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style pottery bowl; pale slip; interior: black, with narrow reserved band below rim; two red bands lined in white on wall; exterior: a springing goat, head lost, to right with added red; at left, large palmette with added red; dot rosette, four petalled rosette, dots, and dotted double spiral as filling ornament; below, two narrow black bands above broad black zone with added red band lined in white; at bottom of sherd, tip of ray and traces of a narrow band in added red.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 34, pl. 21, no. 20)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.174)
